title: The Dust Is Listening
body: I sneezed, the chandelier sneezed back. Dear me, tomorrow, if this hall starts applauding too, just bow and keep merging.

title: Future Me Owes You Tea
body: Today you fixed one tiny shelf and somehow my whole mood stopped wobbling. Dear me, tomorrow, thank you for doing the small brave thing.

title: Banquet of Accidents
body: I tried to bake confidence. It came out as crumbs, then you merged them into a miracle. Dear me, tomorrow, same recipe please.

title: When The Echo Winked
body: The cyan glow blinked like it knew our secret: we are both pretending to be calm. Dear me, tomorrow, keep pretending. It is working.

title: Tiny Miracle Receipt
body: Invoice attached: 1 repaired hallway, 3 hopeful sighs, and one laugh at 2 a.m. Dear me, tomorrow, payment accepted in courage.
